content.description: Stand start on some decent holds, and climb what you can to the top. This has an easy topout if you use the tree. It is a good warm-up.
content.location: It is in between the dirty crack below the tree and the graffiti.

content.description: This route is just the top few moves of "Ooga-Booga". Match start the big pocket to the right of the red spray-painted triangle. Make a couple moves to the top, and then mantel. This is short but sweet.
content.location: On the right side of the outcropping, start just right of the red triangle.

content.description: Start low on the pocket and small sidepull, and move up to the rail and the chip. Traverse right to the awesome pocket, and mantel up over the top.
content.location: On the right side of the little outcropping near the faded graffiti, the starting holds are below and to the left of the spray-painted red triangle.

content.description: Hills Pond Upper is a smaller outcropping of rock up and to the left of the lower cliff. This small cliff ranges from 8-12 feet in height. There's a couple of cracks and some blocky face climbing of decent rock quality. Some sections of this rock would really benefit from a good scrubbing (bring a couple of brushes). Watch out for the little bit of broken glass, and consider bringing a small baggy and doing a couple minutes of clean-up.
